posts.name: AfterTen
posts.cooked:
I’m driving a real swerve robot and using the AdvantageKit SparkSwerve Template as the base for the swerve code. Minimal changes have been made to the template.

The issue is when I push up on the joystick the real robot moves forward and drives normally. Same with side to side.

But when watching in AdvantageScope, when pushing up (+X) robot moves to the right (-Y).

Also concerning, but looking to just fix the orientation issue first, is the visualization of the robot in AS is very slow even though the robot is moving at max speed (around 3.2 meters/s).

At a loss here.

Here’s a little example from one of my logs

posts.name: Andy Gasser
posts.cooked:
If you add a link to your code we can take a look. Most likely you have a coordinate error, where X and Y are swapped. You say “when pushing up (+X)” but pushing away from you on a joystick is (-Y) so it’s not clear what you’re doing. It would be correct that “up” on the field image on the left would be (+X).

Take a look at the WPILib Coordinate System page and see if you can spot how what you have is different from what’s expected.

link_counts.title: Coordinate System — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.name: AfterTen
posts.cooked:
The code can be checked here…

Dean-Elevator

Contribute to wavelength3572/Robot-2025 development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Rishi Desai
posts.cooked: Check the orientation of your piegon and how you have instantiated each module. Secondly have you run the characterization tests?

posts.name: AfterTen
posts.cooked:
This is not really new code. The physical robot drives perfectly fine. It’s fast and drives in the direction you want when operating the joysticks. The pigeon is dead center of the robot and is initialized to zero on startup so whatever direction the robot is facing is downfield.

This is using last years robot with new code base but still very similar to last year since we started with the AK template as well. Last years robot, all was well.

Ran the characterization tests got the values for Ks and Kv. Square robot so SwerveDriveKinematics are pretty straight forward.

I’m just not getting the disconnect between the the Swerve tab showing the Measured SwerveChassisSpeeds data, which is perfectly normal and poseestimation showing the robot driving opposite and slow.

This our 3rd year on swerve and AK/AS so none of the setup and operation is really new.

Just didn’t know if anyone had seen this before.

Team has robot tore apart right now for refurbishment. Once it’s drivable again I may just start from scratch and slowly add back in my modifications and see what starts tripping it up.

posts.name: AfterTen

The Mechanical Advantage swerve template for SparkMax they subtract the swerve module zero offset from the SparkMax encoder value every period…
